page.title: 01Ardvasar to Tormore
page.content: The district has a rocky shore of Torridonian sandstone bounded by sea (South of Sleat) rising to fairly high hills. Some arable land but mainly hill pasture. Some woodland. Minly a crofting area. Ardvasar has a shop,hotel post office, church, hall and some private council housing. Other houses on Crofts the and of which is worked sporadically. Some employment in forestry, roads, transport and seasonal tourist trade. Some salmon and Lobster fishing and whelk collection for sending to markets in south. MAin featues are rock ormations, especially Eilean Sgorach, a rocky island offshore, panoramic views to mainland encompassing Knoydart, Morar, Ardnamurchan an the Isle of Eigg. From Armadale Pier a car ferry plies
